title: The Sun Broke Through the Clouds for This Couple’s Forest Wedding in the Bhutanese Himalayas
desc: Tara Susanto-Joseph and James Joseph, who founded a forest restoration company, held their wedding among pine trees in the mountains of Bhutan.

title: Derry man (23) dies after fifth-storey balcony railing collapses in London
desc: Joshua’s parents have said that they are currently seeking answers from a local housing association on why the balcony collapsed.

title: Timothée Chalamet thanks French fans at Marty Supreme Paris premiere
desc: Timothée Chalamet honors French cinephiles at Marty Supreme premiere, joking about ticket prices and fan support

title: Trump's Kennedy Center closure shocks the National Symphony Orchestra
desc: President Donald Trump’s decision to close the Kennedy Center for two years starting this summer came with no notice to the National Symphony Orchestra.

title: Xi Jinping speaks with Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump on eve of Ukraine war anniversary
desc: The Chinese leader and his Russian counterpart hailed the success of the relationship between the two countries and pledged to further ties in a call broadcast on state television.

title: says white farmers who left thought they were superior
desc: PRESIDENT Emmerson Mnangagwa has defended government’s Land Reform Programme, declaring that white farmers who upped and left the country, as a result, thought that they were superior to the “African people of Zimbabwe.”

title: Crocodile seen in waters near Changi Naval Base; second reported sighting after Sentosa
desc: A crocodile was sighted by the Republic of Singapore Navy near Changi Naval Base, prompting increased monitoring and public safety advisories. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Ex-JI chief to hold high-level meetings in Kabul in bid to ease Pak-Afghan tensions: sources
desc: Will discuss border trade and crossings in first stages, along with Islamabad's security concerns later on

title: FG partners World Bank, AfDB on climate action
desc: The Federal Ministry of Livestock Development says it will collaborate with the World Bank Group and the AfDB to address climate change

title: Aaron George century helps India down Afghanistan in semi-final
desc: The Indian cricket team, riding on Aaron George's century and fifties from Vaibhav Sooryavanshi and Ayush Mhatre, beat Afghanistan in the U19 World Cup 2026 semi-finals.
